page.title: 15NW.SHERBORNE:GOLF
page.content: Apart from the playing fields belonging to St. Aldhelm's School {Sherborne Golf Course}is the only {recreation area}contained within the block. The Club, founded in 1894, have their present course on the high ground a mile and a half north of the town. Originally a 9 hole course, it was enlarged to{18 holes}in 1936. The clubhouse, rebuilt after being burned down in 1955 and further extended in 1965 is on the north side of Clatcombe Lane. The first ten holes are on fairly{flat ground}on the south side of the lane. The 513 yard dog-leg second skirts the club's practice area. The remaining eight holes, including the short, downhill twelfth, are on the{hill slopes}north of the lane. Par for the course is seventy.
